data.title: TGMA: Winners of Artiste of the Year award from 1999 to 2023
data.meta_description: The Artiste of the Year category has been the much-anticipated category of the Ghana Music Awards since its inception in 1999.
data.text:
The Artiste of the Year category has been the much-anticipated category of the Ghana Music Awards since its inception in 1999.

For 25 years now, conversations and debates surrounding this category has been overwhelming as it is the topmost category of the award scheme – the bragging right alone that it comes with is non-limited.

25th TGMA: Chris Attoh returns as host, co-host with TV3’s Naa Ashorkor for the second time

It is the award of every Ghanaian musician dream. Debate about who wins the Artiste of the Year this time has not been left out as fans are already wrangling on social media over who wins the award this year.

The nominees; Sarkodie, Stonebwoy, King Promise, Kuami Eugene, Black Sherif and Nacee are fervently looking forward to the awards night with each of them hoping to clinch the covetous award.

Sarkodie has already won the award twice in 2010 and in 2012, Stonebwoy and Black Sherif being one-time winners in 2015 and 2023 respectively.

In 2017, Joe Mettle shocked music lovers when he became the first Ghanaian gospel musician to win the topmost award.

Black Sherif’s winning of the award was an expected achievement as the talented musician was a reckoning force in the music industry last year releasing hits and achieving global recognition.

We have compiled a list of all the winners of the “Artiste of the Year” from 1999 to date.
